title: Liverpool set to pay tribute to Ronnie Moran ahead of Merseyside derby with a mosaic and minute's applause

Liverpool will pay tribute to one of their greatest ever legends Ronnie Moran during the Merseyside derby on Saturday with a mosaic in the Kop and the players observing a minutes silence. 
Moran was ’Mr Liverpool’ after serving the club with great distinction as a player, captain, coach and caretaker manager during his memorable 49-years at Anfield. 
The 83-year-old sadly passed away last week and Liverpool legends past and present including Steven Gerrard and Kenny Dalglish paid their respects at the funeral which took place on Thursday. Steven Gerrard and Jamie Carragher pay their respects to Ronnie Moran (Photo: Liverpool Echo) 
Liverpool are now preparing for the ultimate send-off during the big derby game with Everton as they display a giant mosaic in remembrance of the legendary Anfield figure. 
Both sets of fans and players will also observe a minute’s applause prior to kick-off in what promises to be another emotional day at Anfield. 
Moran became a legend at the Reds after he captained the club and won the old First Division titles in 1964 an 1966. Roy Evans, Joe Fagan and Ronnie Moran celebrate with the European Cup in 1984 (Photo: Getty) 
The talented defender made 379 appearances before he was invited onto the coaching staff by Bill Shanky and became part of the famous boot room. 
After being part of the backroom staff that saw the club win FOUR European Cups in an incredible seven-year spell and 11 more titles, he relished the chance to work alongside the likes of Bob Paisley, Joe Fagan, Kenny Dalglish, Graeme Souness and Roy Evans. poll loading Could this Liverpool and Everton combined XI win the Premier League? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
